moderatorConfig.name: Future professions in logistics
moderatorConfig.description: Which future profession in logistics do you find most interesting? Answer the questions and find out!

participant.score: Your scores for each of the classes in this test were as follows:

A.name: Drone pilot
A.description: A drone pilot controls small aircraft, so-called drones, without being in the air and flying along. In the future, drones will be another option for transporting goods such as small parcels or delivering very urgent medical products. They will not only be used to transport parcels, but could also be used to inspect parts of machines that are difficult to reach using a drone. One of the tasks here is to plan when and where the drone should fly. This involves thinking about the best routes for the drone so that it arrives quickly and safely. Before a drone can fly, the pilot must ensure that it is in good condition. He checks the drone, programs it so that it knows where to fly and makes sure that everything is working properly. Other preparations also need to be made, such as obtaining permission to fly so that the drone can take off at all. Finally, a drone pilot flies the drone and possibly controls it from a computer. They must be able to control it very precisely and always ensure that the drone flies safely. A drone pilot also learns a lot about technology and must adhere to many rules so that no one is disturbed or endangered by the drone.

B.name: Driver of self-driving trucks
B.description: Trucks of the future will be able to drive themselves thanks to the underlying technology and communicate with other trucks driving behind them. The driver therefore does not steer the trucks himself, but rather helps the trucks to drive all by themselves. They make sure that everything remains safe, even when the truck is driving itself. The main task in this job is to monitor the truck and ensure that everything is working correctly. In this job, you have to be able to react quickly and be ready to take the wheel if the truck suddenly can't drive itself, for example in the event of a technical problem or if an unexpected situation arises on the road. Another task is to plan where and how the truck should drive. Sometimes the route has to be changed if there is a roadworks site on the planned route, for example. Even though you work independently a lot, you still communicate with the team and with a central office that helps to find the best route and organize everything well. In this job, the driver also has to make sure that the truck is in good condition. Checks and small repairs must be carried out to ensure that the truck is safe. You also have to make sure that the load is safe and that everything is on board that the delivery bills say it should be.

C.name: Warehouse specialist of the future
C.description: This job involves working in a warehouse where many different products are stored, moved and sorted by people and machines. The main task is to ensure that everything runs smoothly in the warehouse. You plan how warehouses should look and be organized in the future so that everything can be found and dispatched quickly. They also plan and use robots, artificial intelligence and automated systems to make work easier and to manage the warehouse. As a specialist, you ensure that machines such as robots and drones work well together and help to complete all tasks quickly and safely. In this profession, you also plan how many people need to work each day and what their tasks are to ensure that everything that happens in the warehouse is correct. It is also important that everything remains safe and clean. The specialist monitors systems to make sure that the quality of work is good and that all rules and regulations are followed. If something goes wrong, for example if a robot breaks down, the specialist is also responsible for solving the problem quickly. Sometimes you even have to control one of the robots yourself. In short, this work is very important to ensure that customers receive their orders quickly and correctly.

D.name: Logistics specialist for urban transport
D.description: The logistics specialist for urban transport deals with transportation in the city. For example, the question arises as to how goods should best be delivered or collected in cities or how routes (paths) should be planned to avoid traffic jams. In this profession, you need to be good at finding the best routes through the city so that deliveries can be made quickly and without disruption from traffic. This involves looking at data and using information about the city to see what the delivery routes are like, what the traffic is like or where congestion often occurs. This can be used to learn and plans can be improved, for example to avoid a traffic jam next time. Another future task will be to look at which means of transportation or devices should be used in the city, such as cars, trucks, robots, drones, bicycles or others. It will be decided which vehicle and which driver is best suited for which delivery. Sometimes you need a large car, sometimes a small one or even a bicycle is sufficient for the delivery. It is also important in this profession to keep an eye on the environment and sustainability. In general, the specialist ensures that traffic in cities flows smoothly. In addition to route planning, they monitor transportation in real time and, if necessary, intervene as quickly as possible in the event of road closures or other unforeseen problems.

E.name: Data analysis expert
E.description: The data analysis expert looks at large amounts of information and tries to find out what it means so that the company can make smart decisions. To do this, data and information from various sources is collected and analyzed. These figures or data can be, for example, sales figures or information about how much customers like the products. Sometimes, however, the data collected is incomplete or incorrect. The expert must therefore find this data and clean it up so that it can be used. Computer programs or mathematical formulas are used to try and identify patterns from the information and data. For example, they could find out which products sell best or at what time of year most people shop. Weather data could also be used to find a pattern and try to predict when the weather is likely to be sunny so that barbecue products can be sold well. Based on what the expert has found out, another task is to make recommendations. For example, the expert might suggest producing more of a product that sells well. The expert also makes reports and diagrams (similar to pictures) showing what they have found out. These help the bosses of the company to make quick and good decisions.

F.name: Expert in robots and automated machines
F.description: The expert in robots and automated machines is like an inventor who figures out how robots or automated devices or systems can help people do their jobs. The experts plan how robots or self-functioning devices can best be used, build these devices, set them up and make sure they work properly. This means they often have to program the robots or devices, teaching them what to do. Another important task is to test the robots to make sure they do their jobs well. However, robots and automated devices should also be further improved if necessary. That's why the experts observe the robots, check the devices and use other data to see what is working well or what can be improved. Sometimes the software needs to be updated so that everything remains state of the art. These experts also make sure that the new robots and systems work well with the computers and programs already in the company. If an error occurs, it is the experts' job to find out what went wrong and solve the problem. In this job, you learn a lot about technologies such as robotics or automatic devices and how to program these devices.

G.name: Sustainability Manager
G.description: The Sustainability Manager has a strong interest in sustainability and environmental protection and ensures that logistics operations and processes are environmentally friendly. One of the tasks is, for example, to find the best transportation routes or select more environmentally friendly means of transport in order to use less diesel or petrol to keep the air clean. In general, the sustainability manager makes sure that means of transportation such as ships or trucks work cleanly when transporting goods. Another task is to use sustainable packaging materials and find ways to reduce waste. The manager considers how materials can be reused or recycled instead of thrown away. For example, an old plastic toy could be melted down and made into something new instead of simply throwing it in the bin. The sustainability manager also works with many other people in the company to ensure that new products are designed to be environmentally friendly. Even when designing a product, thought is given to how it can later be easily repaired, reused or recycled. The manager also makes sure that the company uses renewable energies such as solar or wind power.

H.name: Data security expert
H.description: Data security experts make sure that all information and data on computers is secure so that no one who is not authorized can see or steal it. To do this, the person in this profession creates rules on how to keep the data in the company secure, especially for companies that have a lot to do with transportation and storage of goods. The person also ensures that these rules are followed. They are also responsible for installing and using programs to protect the data and information. These are programs such as firewalls, which are like an invisible barrier, and antivirus software to protect the computers from viruses and hackers. It is important to build up a broad knowledge of network technology and IT infrastructure in this profession. Another task of the expert is to regularly check whether all systems, computers and devices are secure and to improve them if necessary. In this profession, it is important to observe and find out if there are any security problems. In the event of an emergency, it is important to react quickly and prioritize problems in order of importance to resolve the most urgent issue as quickly as possible. Plans must be made in advance in case something bad happens, such as a hacker attack, so that the company can react quickly and the data remains secure. To do this, it is necessary to keep up to date with new threats to data security.

I.name: Buyer of the future
I.description: The buyer of the future in a company has an important task: they look for and buy everything the company needs to function well. This can be very simple things like office supplies or large machines. So they think about how to buy things smarter and better. The buyer looks at many offers and selects the best suppliers who offer good products at a fair price. Computer programs are used to help make the best decisions or provide suggestions. If there are problems, for example if a supplier cannot deliver on time, then the buyer must quickly find a solution, perhaps another supplier who can deliver more quickly. In general, you always have to keep your eyes open in this job to see what new, exciting products are available on the market. You also have to pay attention to how much money the company spends on purchases and keep an eye on expenditure. This involves negotiating prices with suppliers to get the best price, much like a flea market. As good business relationships are becoming increasingly important, a big focus in this job is on building good relationships with suppliers and maintaining the good relationship. This means that sociability and a good feel for people are just as important as negotiating skills.

J.name: Human-machine collaboration planner
J.description: A human-machine collaboration planner ensures that people and technical devices such as robots and other machines can work well together. This is important so that technology can help people in their work. To do this, the planner looks at the workplace and the tasks and decides which technologies, such as robots or automated systems, are best to be used in the company. The planner looks closely at what best suits the tasks of the employees. This job also involves a lot of observation, for example how well people and machines work together and whether the employees get on well with the machines. It is also the job of understanding what employees need to do their work well. The technologies are adapted so that they really help the employees and don't get in the way. This also involves working closely with technicians to ensure that the machines are easy for employees to operate and that people and machines can communicate well with each other. For example, operating errors are rectified. This job also involves ensuring that everything is safe in the workplace. To do this, you develop guidelines on how employees can handle the machines safely.

K.name: Project Manager Modern Logistics
K.description: The project manager of the future plays an important role in the planning, monitoring and optimization of logistics processes. This job involves working on many different projects and future topics, such as sustainability, as well as means of transportation and routes. For example, new processes are introduced for shipping goods, packaging or storing goods. Another example could be the introduction of new computer programs or automated systems and technologies such as robots, which also affects logistics. For example, robots help to sort and send parcels quickly and accurately. The project manager takes on a coordinating role between the various work groups and departments. A project manager must also always make sure that the projects are running smoothly and check whether everything is on schedule and whether the money is being spent correctly. If problems arise, a solution must be found quickly. In addition, the project manager informs the management and other departments about the current status and progress of the project and after a project is finished, the project manager makes reports and presentations about how everything went.
